meanings.definition: In an unhealthy or harmful manner.
meanings.sent1: She ate unwholesomely and felt sick afterwards.
meanings.sent2: He knew he had been eating unwholesomely when his energy levels dropped.
meanings.sent3: The cat unwholesomely devoured the entire cake when no one was looking.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds hung unwholesomely over the town, foretelling a storm.
meanings.sent5: The smell of decay filled the room unwholesomely, making everyone uncomfortable.

meanings.definition: In a way that is not conducive to good health or well-being.
meanings.sent1: The polluted air was unwholesomely thick with toxins.
meanings.sent2: She slept unwholesomely late and missed her morning workout.
meanings.sent3: The children unwholesomely giggled during the serious meeting.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts wandered unwholesomely to memories of the past.
meanings.sent5: The eerie silence of the abandoned house felt unwholesomely unsettling.
